intro: Cymopterus longiradiatus, commonly known as the long-rayed evening-primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its seeds are enclosed in a capsule that splits open to release the seeds when mature. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
